column3: You do need cs_main for that.\n
Updated the commit to use chainActive.Tip()->nTime directly\n
Changed to use less ridiculously long strings.\n

utACK

On Tuesday, August 4, 2015, Pieter Wuille notifications@github.com wrote:

> utACK
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6489#issuecomment-127392899.
Any specific reason to read the block from disk here? Reminder: `tip` itself, a `CBlockIndex`, also has `nTime`\n
Is there no styleguide for the bitcoin codebase that says ">250 character lines are just TOO LONG @casey"?!\n
This string is going to be translated via gettext (that's what the "_" is for) so it's better than it appear in the source as one line, as opposed to being broken up.\n
Not really. It indicates that the computer is the owner of the date & time, which in this case it is.\n
